result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa L. Merchant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Melissa L. Merchant
Current: 717 Jackson St, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 05-14-2015)
Prior: 750 Ridgeland Avenue, Schofield, WI 54476
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (includes 14CF417, filed in 14CF590)

Clerk Shirley.
Case Called: 1:09
Includes: 14CF417 and 14CF590
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer. Def appears with Atty Paul Goetz.
Atty Gramer states that a Preliminary hearing needs to be held in both files.
Information has been filed for each case. Atty Goetz waives the preliminary hearing and any reading of the information and wishes to proceed to sentencing.
Waiver of Prelim filed.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
State moves to: 14CF417>>Count 2>>DRI
14CF590>>Count 1, Count 2, Count 3 and Count 4>>DRI
Court grants.
PLEA: 14CF417>>BJ/Felony>>No Contest
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: WS; Probation for 2 years with Conditions of: Assessment/Counseling/Treatment including AODA deemed appropriate by agent, absolute sobriety, good faith effort to maintain FTE/School, CC including new surcharge. Concurrent to probation now serving in Langlade Co. Has 130 days credit if revoked.
Adj: 1:22
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Case called: 9:53am. INCLUDES 14CF417, 14CF590.  Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and prose. Matter set for Prelims today. State indicates that Defendant informed state that she was hiring Atty Zach Glascock. State is ready to proceed today with prelims. Crt addresses Defendant re: counsel. Defendant states she contacted Public Defenders Office and will have representation by the end of the week. Crt addresses time limits for prelim. Crt accepts Waiver of Time Limits on 14CF590. DATES: Calendar Call 7/21/14 @ 1pm. CC: BR 1. Adjourned: 9:55am.
INCLUDES 14CF417 & 14CF590 No possession or consumption of controlled substances without valid prescription and then only take as prescribed.
